dataList.content: Allow me to give you a rundown of the plan.
Our primary objective is to infiltrate the casino incognito. This will be critical for the successful recovery of the Golden Bough.
According to the information we’ve acquired, the casino has three entrances.
One for ordinary visitors, one reserved for VIPs, and lastly, the backdoor used by employees.
We’ll split into 3 groups to cover each entrance. 4 of us will disguise as croupiers, 4 as guests, and the last 4 will play the role of VIPs.
Working in smaller groups will certainly draw less attention.
It is wiser to divide rather than unite.
You can find your assigned roles in the envelopes distributed.
Also, the company's higher-ups have expressed concern about our performance.
They stress that the company’s future plans hinge on our successful retrieval of the Golden Bough through this operation.
Therefore, we will carry out the objective by means of a joint operation.
<Joint operation?>
Our partner is a special forces unit consisting of professionals and veterans.
I believe they are now monikered the "LCC," short for the Limbus Company Clearance Department. Rest assured that their abilities far exceed our own in espionage.
Aren't 12 people already enough? Anything more than that is basically a crowd.
Guess someone finally realized that more isn’t always merrier.
Wowzer! I haven’t met staff from other teams before. Where are they now?
Hong Lu looked around as though he was expecting Faust to introduce us to our "partners" any second.
... Needless to say, no one showed up.
We’ll be heading to the pawnshop.
Is pawning still a thing these days?
We’re in the so-called "pawnbroker’s avenue." Most businesses double as pawnshops here.
That shop over there is our rendezvous point. Let's head inside.
